body:
Comment 6 by **QQ510371827**: 
The result posted at #4 is from standard cmd.exe. Yep,make.bat works but without testing
unit.I tried debugging and get some more clues.
FYI,
I inserted println at path_windows_test.go,
    cmd := &exec.Cmd{
	Path: comspec,
	Args: []string{`/c`, cmdfile},
	Env:  []string{`Path=` + tt.list},
	Dir:  tmp,
     }
    out, err := cmd.CombinedOutput()
+   fmt.Printf("path=%s    Args=%v    Env=%v    Dir=%s    out=%q   
err=%v\n",cmd.Path,cmd.Args,cmd.Env,cmd.Dir,out,err)
        fmt.Printf("%v\n",err)
    switch {
	case err != nil:
	t.Errorf("%d,%d: execution error %v\n%q", ti, i, err, out)
    ...
    ...

The output is as follows,
